subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Universities: The Church's Gift to Knowledge
description: A short lesson to help you apply Universities: The Church's Gift to Knowledge.

hook.text: Oxford, Cambridge, Paris, Bologna. The first universities were all founded by the Church. A religious legacy.

buildup.text: In the 12th century, cathedral schools evolved into universities. The Church funded, staffed, and protected them.

discovery.text: Universities taught theology alongside logic, math, and natural philosophy. The Church encouraged systematic thinking.

twist.text: Many breakthroughs happened at these church-founded schools. The institutions religion built eventually challenged it.

climax.text: The university system is religion's greatest practical gift to civilization. Knowledge thrives in structure.

punchline.text: The Church built the first universities. Its own creation challenged it.

quiz.question: Who founded the first European universities?
